description_txt: stated on June 26, 2012 in a newspaper column:
quote_txt: "Fireworks have never been safer, and their use continues to increase each year."

description_txt: stated on June 26, 2012 in a radio show:
quote_txt: "We’re spending $12,000 bucks a kid a year in the school system."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in on the Internet:
quote_txt: "In 1950, corporations paid $3 in taxes for every $1 by a worker. Today, they pay 22 cents for every $1 by a worker."

description_txt: stated on June 9, 2012 in a speech to the Republican Party of Texas convention in Fort Worth.:
quote_txt: Says he "passed" eight measures, including ones to prevent groping at airport security checks and to bar "sanctuary" cities in Texas.

description_txt: stated on June 19, 2012 in a speech to the Business Roundtable in Frankenmuth, Mich.:
quote_txt: Says Dow Chemical decided to build a plant in Saudi Arabia rather than Oklahoma due to the impact of environmental regulations on the supply of natural gas.

description_txt: stated on June 12, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Statistics show that more people at this time telecommute than they ride carpools, mass transit, bicycle or walk."

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2012 in a TV interview with Greta Van Susteren:
quote_txt: A company with "20 employees" could go "out of business" because of health care law requirements to buy insurance.

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in comments on CNBC:
quote_txt: The Medicaid expansion is "going to cost Florida $1.9 billion a year."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: Says the health care law rations care, like systems in Canada and Great Britain.

description_txt: stated on June 17, 2012 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: Tim Kaine "made Virginia the best state for business four years in a row."

description_txt: stated on June 6, 2012 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "Before Act 10, the total cost of public sector employees’ employment was 29 percent higher than that in the private sector. After the act, it’s still 22 percent higher."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2012 in a speech on the House floor:
quote_txt: "Just in the past 10 years, college tuition has increased 28 percent."

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2012 in a speech in the Ohio House:
quote_txt: Lorain "is the poorest urban school district in the state of Ohio."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2012 in Georgia Green Party flier:
quote_txt: The transportation tax is regressive, and Emory University is "literally getting its own transit line at virtually no cost to itself."

description_txt: stated on June 19, 2012 in a speech on the floor of the U.S. Senate:
quote_txt: "No one in Rhode Island -- not just children, no one in Rhode Island -- should eat more than one serving of freshwater fish caught in our state each month."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • July 2, 2012

description_txt: stated on June 12, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: As Massachusetts governor, Mitt Romney used a line-item veto to cut "millions of dollars for firefighting equipment," including firefighters' "coats, pants, helmets and boots."

description_txt: stated on June 25, 2012 in a speech on the state Senate floor:
quote_txt: "New Jersey's citizens are working at the highest rate in three years."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2012 in a speech.:
quote_txt: President Obama's health care law is "a government takeover of healthcare."

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2012 in a House floor debate:
quote_txt: "People who wash cars at home will use approximately 80 percent more water than they do in a car wash."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • July 1, 2012

description_txt: stated on June 2, 2012 in rally for coal miners:
quote_txt: "(Environmentalists) said ‘We’re only going to stop coal mining above 2,000 feet.’ ... Well guess where all the coal in the state of Tennessee is? Above 2,000 feet."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in a fundraising letter:
quote_txt: President Obama’s health-care law will "add trillions of dollars in debt."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • June 30, 2012

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2012 in a rally outside the N.H. Statehouse.:
quote_txt: Says Rep. Charles Bass "supports privatizing Social Security, risking trillions more on Wall Street."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2012 in in a news release :
quote_txt: "Oregon schools receive millions of dollars per year in federal school lunch assistance and yet they are required to spend that money almost anywhere but Oregon."

description_txt: stated on June 8, 2012 in an email to the press on June 8, 2012:
quote_txt: Says Ann Kuster said the debate over America’s debt limit is not an important issue of the day.

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in a statement reacting to the Supreme Court decision upholding the law.:
quote_txt: Says the federal health care law upheld by the Supreme Court "has improved or saved the lives of more than 4,000 Texans" otherwise prevented from obtaining health coverage due to pre-existing conditions.

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in a speech at the White House:
quote_txt: "If you're one of the more than 250 million Americans who already have health insurance, you will keep your health insurance."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in a speech in Washington, D.C. :
quote_txt: "Obamacare … means that for up to 20 million Americans, they will lose the insurance they currently have, the insurance that they like and they want to keep."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2012:
quote_txt: "Austin is the biggest city in America with a Tier One research university (UT-Austin) but without a medical school."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2012 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says "Barack Obama and his team" are "socialists in every respect of the word."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2012 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says there are "$500 billion in Medicare cuts required to pay for this flawed [health care law]."
